notes.text:
A security update is now available for Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.3 from the Customer Portal.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.3 is a standalone server, based on the Keycloak project, that provides authentication and standards-based single sign-on capabilities for web and mobile applications.

This release of Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.3.8 serves as a replacement for Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.3.7, and includes bug fixes and enhancements, which are documented in the Release Notes document linked to in the References.

Security Fix(es):

* keycloak: security issue on reset credential flow (CVE-2020-1718)

* undertow: servletPath is normalized incorrectly leading to dangerous application mapping which could result in security bypass (CVE-2020-1757)

* jackson-mapper-asl: XML external entity similar to CVE-2016-3720 (CVE-2019-10172)

* hibernate: SQL injection issue in Hibernate ORM (CVE-2019-14900)

* cxf: reflected XSS in the services listing page (CVE-2019-17573)

* resteasy: Improper validation of response header in MediaTypeHeaderDelegate.java class (CVE-2020-1695)

* Wildfly: EJBContext principal is not popped back after invoking another EJB using a different Security Domain (CVE-2020-1719)

* keycloak: improper verification of certificate with host mismatch could result in information disclosure (CVE-2020-1758)

* cryptacular: excessive memory allocation during a decode operation (CVE-2020-7226)

* keycloak: problem with privacy after user logout (CVE-2020-1724)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat products and services.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.3.8 security update

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference

notes.text: A flaw was found in org.codehaus.jackson:jackson-mapper-asl:1.9.x libraries such that an XML external entity (XXE) vulnerability affects codehaus's jackson-mapper-asl libraries. This vulnerability is similar to CVE-2016-3720. The primary threat from this flaw is data integrity.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jackson-mapper-asl: XML external entity similar to CVE-2016-3720
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat OpenStack Platform ships OpenDaylight, which contains the vulnerable jackson-databind. However, OpenDaylight does not expose jackson-databind in a way that would make it vulnerable, lowering the impact of the vulnerability for OpenDaylight. As such, Red Hat will not be providing a fix for OpenDaylight at this time.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).

vulnerabilities.title: jackson-mapper-asl: XML external entity similar to CVE-2016-3720

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

notes.text: A flaw was found in Hibernate ORM. A SQL injection in the implementation of the JPA Criteria API can permit unsanitized literals when a literal is used in the SELECT or GROUP BY parts of the query. This flaw could allow an attacker to access unauthorized information or possibly conduct further attacks.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: hibernate: SQL injection issue in Hibernate ORM
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
OpenDaylight:
In RHOSP10, RHOSP13 and RHOSP14 editions of Red Hat OpenStack platform, the hibernate-jfa library shipped with OpenDaylight is contains a flaw in the processing of SQL queries. The hibernate-jha implemenation is not used in a vulnerable way in OpenDaylight, preventing the potential for SQL injection.

Red Hat Satellite 6.2, 6.3 and 6.4 contains affected versions of hibernate-core in its candlepin component. However, that component does not use hibernate-core in a vulnerable way.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).
There is no currently known mitigation for this flaw.

vulnerabilities.title: hibernate: SQL injection issue in Hibernate ORM

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: By default, Apache CXF creates a /services page containing a listing of the available endpoint names and addresses. This webpage is vulnerable to a reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attack, which allows a malicious actor to inject javascript into the web page. Please note that the attack exploits a feature which is not typically not present in modern browsers, who remove dot segments before sending the request. However, Mobile applications may be vulnerable.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: cxf: reflected XSS in the services listing page
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).
Mitigate this flaw by disabling the service listing altogether; via setting the "hide-service-list-page" servlet parameter to "true".

vulnerabilities.title: cxf: reflected XSS in the services listing page

notes.text: A flaw was found in Resteasy, where an improper input validation results in returning an illegal header that integrates into the server's response. This flaw may result in an injection, which leads to unexpected behavior when the HTTP response is constructed.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: resteasy: Improper validation of response header in MediaTypeHeaderDelegate.java class

notes.text: A flaw was found in the reset credential flow in Keycloak. This flaw allows an attacker to gain unauthorized access to the application.

notes.text: A flaw was found in wildfly. The EJBContext principle is not popped back after invoking another EJB using a different Security Domain. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity.

notes.text: A flaw was found in Keycloak. This flaw allows a malicious user that is currently logged in, to see the personal information of a previously logged out user in the account manager section.

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: A flaw was found in Undertow, where the servlet container causes the servletPath to normalize incorrectly by truncating the path after the semicolon. The flaw may lead to application mapping, resulting in a security bypass.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: undertow: servletPath is normalized incorrectly leading to dangerous application mapping which could result in security bypass
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).
The issue can be mitigated by configuring UrlPathHelper to ignore the servletPath via setting "alwaysUseFullPath".

vulnerabilities.title: undertow: servletPath is normalized incorrectly leading to dangerous application mapping which could result in security bypass

cwe.name: Improper Validation of Certificate with Host Mismatch

notes.text: A flaw was found in Keycloak, where it does not perform the TLS hostname verification while sending emails using the SMTP server. This flaw allows an attacker to perform a man-in-the-middle (MITM) attack.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: keycloak: improper verification of certificate with host mismatch could result in information disclosure
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).
Turn off all kinds of email notifications including password reset mails.

vulnerabilities.title: keycloak: improper verification of certificate with host mismatch could result in information disclosure

cwe.name: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling

notes.text: CiphertextHeader.java in Cryptacular 1.2.3, as used in Apereo CAS and other products, allows attackers to trigger excessive memory allocation during a decode operation, because the nonce array length associated with "new byte" may depend on untrusted input within the header of encoded data.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: cryptacular: excessive memory allocation during a decode operation
notes.title: Vulnerability summary
